# alignment

**Instance Property**

The alignment mode of the text in the receiver’s cell.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var alignment: NSTextAlignment { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property can be one of the following constants: `NSLeftTextAlignment`, `NSRightTextAlignment`,`NSCenterTextAlignment`, `NSJustifiedTextAlignment`, or `NSNaturalTextAlignment`. The default value is `NSNaturalTextAlignment`. Setting this property while the cell is currently being edited aborts the edits to change the alignment.

## Formatting Text

- **font**: The font used to draw text in the receiver’s cell.
- **lineBreakMode**: The line break mode to use for text in the control’s cell.
- **usesSingleLineMode**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the text in the control’s cell uses single line mode.
- **formatter**: The receiver’s formatter.
- **baseWritingDirection**: The initial writing direction used to determine the actual writing direction for text.
